body_html: Hey @katrin-k, about 2) how to avoid it in the future: it's best to always work in branches. When you start a new feature, be sure to branch them off the master branch. There are several tweaks to your terminal command prompt that always show you which branch you're in. I find that extremely helpful.

There are several tweaks to your terminal command prompt that always show you which branch you're in. I find that extremely helpful.
body: Hey @katrin-k, about 2) how to avoid it in the future: it's best to always work in branches. When you start a new feature, be sure to branch them off the `master` branch. There are several tweaks to your terminal command prompt that always show you which branch you're in. I find that extremely helpful.
